title: Marcelo Ortiz M.
text:
I’m an Assistant Professor at Universitat Pompeu Fabra, affiliated with the Barcelona School of Economics and the Barcelona School of Management.
My research lies at the intersection of accounting and corporate governance. I’m fortunate that my research has been published in leading journals, including three publications in journals of the FT 50 List.
I also hold a Ramon y Cajal Fellowship from the Spanish Ministry for Science and Innovation.
I co-organize the Barcelona Accounting Summer Seminars and Workshops.
CV link.
Spotlight:

Policy Impact: Our findings on the role of transparency thresholds for M&As were incorporated into the discussion of IFRS 3 Business Combinations by the UK Endorsement Board and analyzed in an IASB Meeting.
Paper accepted at the European Accounting Review.
Next presentations: SKEMA Business School, CUNEF University, St. Gallen Financial Economics Workshop, PUC-Chile, BSE Summer forum.
New Working Paper: “Industry Information and the Market for Top Executives” with Francisco Urzua and Paolo Volpin.
New Working Paper: “Dynamic Contracting and Corporate Tax Evasion” with Juan Imbet and Vincent Tena.

title: About
text:
I grew up in Chile, moving around Viña del Mar and Santiago, an area renowned for its beautiful valleys, snowy mountains, and stunning coastline.
I completed all my degrees at Universidad Adolfo Ibañez, starting with an undergraduate degree in industrial engineering, followed by a Master of Science in Financial Engineering, and then a PhD in Finance. When I wasn’t studying, I spent most of my weekends engaged in water sports, hiking, and photography. Below are some of my pictures from Chile!
I moved to the Netherlands in 2018 as a visiting PhD student at Erasmus University. In 2019, I started working at Universitat Pompeu Fabra.
Before starting my PhD, I worked as a financial trader for five years, handling interest and liquidity risk exposure in Itau Bank (formerly “Corpbanca”).
